actions.text: The House Committee on Rules reported an original measure, H. Rept. 101-890, by Mr. Bonior.

Rule provides for consideration of H.R. 5399. All points of order against consideration of the bill are waived. During consideration all points of order for failure to comply with clause 2 of rule XXI against certain provisions of the bill are waived. Measure will be read by section. Specified amendments are in order. It shall be in order to consider en bloc amendments numbered 1 printed in the Rules Committee report. Said amendments shall be debatable for 20 minutes, and are not subject to a demand for a division of the question and if adopted shall become original text. En bloc amendments numbered 2 in the report shall be debatable for 40 minutes, and are not subject to a demand for a division of the question. Amendment numbered 3 in the report shall be debatable for one hour. None of the amendments are subject to amendment.
Placed on the House Calendar, Calendar No. 194.
DEBATE - The House proceeded with one hour of debate.
The previous question was ordered without objection.
On agreeing to the resolution Agreed to by voice vote.
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.

official_title: Waiving certain points of order against consideration of the bill (H.R. 5399) making appropriations for the Legislative Branch for the fiscal year ending September 30, 1991, and for other purposes.

summary.text: Waives points of order against the consideration of H.R. 5399 (legislative branch appropriations).

titles.title: Waiving certain points of order against consideration of the bill (H.R. 5399) making appropriations for the Legislative Branch for the fiscal year ending September 30, 1991, and for other purposes.
